alert.note: Alert for Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 27 at 10:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Florida... Little Manatee River At Wimauma at US 301 affecting Hillsborough County. Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Florida... Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. .Heavy rains associated with Hurricane Ian will greatly impact local rivers. For the Alafia...including Lithia , Riverview near US 301...Major flooding is forecast. For the Little Manatee...including Wimauma at US 301...Major flooding is forecast. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Myakka River At Myakka River State Park. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Most of Myakka State Park is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 9.1 feet Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 10/23/1952. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Myakka River Myakka River Stat 7.0 7.7 Tue 10 am 7.6 8.0 9.1 10.1 10.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM EDT.
